content.prompt: Let f and g be continuous functions such that ∫ 0 10 f ( x ) d x = 21 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4522@ ∫ 0 10 1 2 g ( x ) d x = 8 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45F5@ and ∫ 3 10 ( f ( x ) − g ( x ) ) d x = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49E0@ . What is the value of ∫ 0 3 ( f ( x ) − g ( x ) ) d x ? MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4826@
